title: Seismic Base Shear for Reinforced Concrete Building
problem: A 5-story reinforced concrete special moment frame building is being designed in Los Angeles, California. The building has a total weight of 25,000 kips and a fundamental period of 0.85 seconds. The site is classified as Site Class D with mapped spectral accelerations $S_s = 1.85g$ and $S_1 = 0.65g$. Determine the seismic base shear using the equivalent lateral force procedure.
given: Building type: Reinforced concrete special moment frame
required: Calculate the seismic base shear $V$ using the equivalent lateral force procedure.

solution_steps.title: Determine Site Coefficients $F_a$ and $F_v$
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Tables 11.4-1 and 11.4-2:

For Site Class D with $S_s = 1.85g$:
$$F_a = 1.0$$ (interpolated between $F_a = 1.0$ at $S_s = 1.5$ and $F_a = 1.0$ at $S_s \geq 2.0$)

For Site Class D with $S_1 = 0.65g$:
$$F_v = 1.5$$ (interpolated between $F_v = 1.6$ at $S_1 = 0.6$ and $F_v = 1.4$ at $S_1 = 0.7$)

solution_steps.title: Calculate Adjusted Spectral Accelerations
solution_steps.content:
Using ASCE 7-16 Equations 11.4-1 and 11.4-2:

$$S_{MS} = F_a \times S_s = 1.0 \times 1.85 = 1.85g$$

$$S_{M1} = F_v \times S_1 = 1.5 \times 0.65 = 0.975g$$

Then, $S_{DS}$ and $S_{D1}$:

$$S_{DS} = \frac{2}{3} \times S_{MS} = \frac{2}{3} \times 1.85 = 1.23g$$

$$S_{D1} = \frac{2}{3} \times S_{M1} = \frac{2}{3} \times 0.975 = 0.65g$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Response Modification Factor $R$
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 12.2-1, for reinforced concrete special moment frame (Type C1):

$$R = 8, \quad \Omega_0 = 3, \quad C_d = 5.5$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Seismic Response Coefficient $C_s$
solution_steps.content:
Using ASCE 7-16 Equation 12.8-2:

$$C_s = \frac{S_{DS}}{R/I_e}$$

For Risk Category II, $I_e = 1.0$

$$C_s = \frac{1.23}{8/1.0} = 0.154$$

**Check upper limit** from Equation 12.8-3:

$$C_s \leq \frac{S_{D1}}{T \times R/I_e} = \frac{0.65}{0.85 \times 8/1.0} = \frac{0.65}{6.8} = 0.096$$

**Check lower limit** from Equation 12.8-5:

$$C_s \geq 0.044 \times S_{DS} \times I_e = 0.044 \times 1.23 \times 1.0 = 0.054$$

Also check: $C_s \geq 0.01$ (minimum)

**Controlling $C_s = 0.096$** (upper limit governs)

solution_steps.title: Calculate Seismic Base Shear $V$
solution_steps.content:
Using ASCE 7-16 Equation 12.8-1:

$$V = C_s \times W = 0.096 \times 25,000 \text{ kips} = 2,400 \text{ kips}$$

final_answer: The seismic base shear $V = 2,400$ kips. Note: The upper limit of $C_s$ governed because the building period $T = 0.85$ sec is less than $T_L$ (typically 8-12 seconds for most of California), indicating the building is in the constant acceleration region of the response spectrum.

title: Vertical Distribution of Seismic Forces
problem: A 6-story steel building has a calculated seismic base shear of 450 kips. The story weights and heights are: Floor 1 (base): 0 kips at 0 ft; Floor 2: 600 kips at 15 ft; Floor 3: 580 kips at 28 ft; Floor 4: 560 kips at 41 ft; Floor 5: 550 kips at 54 ft; Floor 6 (roof): 400 kips at 67 ft. The fundamental period $T = 0.65$ seconds. Distribute the seismic forces to each floor level.
required: Calculate the seismic force at each floor level using the vertical distribution procedure.

solution_steps.title: Determine Exponent $k$
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Section 12.8.3, the exponent $k$ depends on building period:

- For $T \leq 0.5$ sec: $k = 1.0$
- For $T \geq 2.5$ sec: $k = 2.0$
- For $0.5 < T < 2.5$ sec:

$$k = 1.0 + 0.5(T - 0.5) = 1.0 + 0.5(0.65 - 0.5)$$

$$k = 1.0 + 0.075 = 1.075$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Seismic Force at Each Floor

final_answer: Seismic forces at each floor level: $F_2 = 35.1$ kips, $F_3 = 67.1$ kips, $F_4 = 98.1$ kips, $F_5 = 130.1$ kips, $F_6 = 119.7$ kips. Total = 450 kips. Note: The forces increase with height, with the maximum force at Floor 5 (not the roof, due to the smaller roof weight).

title: Seismic Design Category Determination
problem: Determine the Seismic Design Category (SDC) for a hospital building located in Seattle, Washington. The site has Site Class C soil conditions. The mapped spectral accelerations are $S_s = 0.65g$ and $S_1 = 0.25g$. The building is 8 stories tall with a fundamental period of 1.2 seconds.
required: Determine the Seismic Design Category (SDC) for this building.

solution_steps.title: Determine Site Coefficients $F_a$ and $F_v$
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.4-1 for Site Class C with $S_s = 0.65g$:
$$F_a = 1.2$$ (interpolated between $F_a = 1.2$ at $S_s = 0.5$ and $F_a = 1.2$ at $S_s = 0.75$)

From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.4-2 for Site Class C with $S_1 = 0.25g$:
$$F_v = 1.5$$

solution_steps.title: Determine SDC Based on Short Period (Table 11.6-1)
solution_steps.content:
For Risk Category IV and $S_{DS} = 0.52g$:

From Table 11.6-1, for $S_{DS}$ between 0.50g and 0.67g:

**SDC = D**

solution_steps.title: Determine SDC Based on 1-Second Period (Table 11.6-2)
solution_steps.content:
For Risk Category IV and $S_{D1} = 0.25g$:

From Table 11.6-2, for $S_{D1}$ between 0.20g and 0.30g:

**SDC = D**

solution_steps.title: Determine Final SDC
solution_steps.content:
Per ASCE 7-16 Section 11.6, the more severe SDC from Tables 11.6-1 and 11.6-2 governs.

Both tables indicate **SDC = D**.

Additionally, check if building can be assigned to SDC E or F:

$$T_S = \frac{S_{D1}}{S_{DS}} = \frac{0.25}{0.52} = 0.48 \text{ sec}$$

Since $T = 1.2$ sec $> T_S = 0.48$ sec, the building is in the long-period region.

Neither $S_s \geq 1.5g$ nor $S_1 \geq 0.6g$, so SDC E or F is not triggered.

final_answer: The Seismic Design Category is **SDC D**. This requires special seismic detailing and a lateral force-resisting system from the prequalified systems in Table 12.2-1 with appropriate height limits and $R$ factors.

title: Overturning Moment from Seismic Forces
problem: Calculate the overturning moment at the base of a 4-story building from seismic forces. The story forces and heights are: $F_1 = 50$ kips at 12 ft, $F_2 = 80$ kips at 24 ft, $F_3 = 100$ kips at 36 ft, $F_4 = 70$ kips at 48 ft. Determine the overturning moment that must be resisted by the foundation.
required: Calculate the total overturning moment at the base of the building.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Moment from Each Floor Force
solution_steps.content:
The overturning moment is calculated as the sum of each floor force multiplied by its height above the base:

$$M_1 = F_1 \times h_1 = 50 \times 12 = 600 \text{ kip-ft}$$

$$M_2 = F_2 \times h_2 = 80 \times 24 = 1,920 \text{ kip-ft}$$

$$M_3 = F_3 \times h_3 = 100 \times 36 = 3,600 \text{ kip-ft}$$

$$M_4 = F_4 \times h_4 = 70 \times 48 = 3,360 \text{ kip-ft}$$

solution_steps.title: Sum Overturning Moments
solution_steps.content:
Total overturning moment:

$$M_T = M_1 + M_2 + M_3 + M_4$$

$$M_T = 600 + 1,920 + 3,600 + 3,360 = 9,480 \text{ kip-ft}$$

solution_steps.title: Check Against Simplified Method
solution_steps.content:
The effective height can be calculated as:

$$h_{eff} = \frac{M_T}{V} = \frac{9,480}{300} = 31.6 \text{ ft}$$

This represents the point of application of the resultant seismic force, which is reasonable for a 4-story building (approximately 66% of total height).

final_answer: The total overturning moment at the base is $M_T = 9,480$ kip-ft. This moment must be resisted by the foundation system, and the building's stabilizing dead load (with appropriate factors) must exceed this overturning moment to prevent uplift.

title: Seismic Base Shear Calculation for a Building
problem: A four-story office building is located in Charleston, South Carolina (Risk Category II). The building has a steel special moment frame (SMF) as the lateral force-resisting system in both directions. The total dead load is 200 psf, and the floor plan is 100 ft × 100 ft on all levels. The roof dead load is also 200 psf. The building height is 60 ft above grade. Site Class D (Stiff Soil) has been determined from geotechnical investigation. The mapped spectral accelerations are $S_s = 0.75g$ and $S_1 = 0.30g$. Determine the seismic base shear for the building using the equivalent lateral force (ELF) procedure.
given: Seismic Force-Resisting System: Steel Special Moment Frame (SMF)
Story height: 15 ft each (total height $h_n = 60$ ft)
Ignore partitions and cladding for dead load calculation (structural dead load only)
required: Calculate the seismic base shear $V$ (in kips) using ASCE 7-16.

solution_steps.title: Determine Seismic Design Category and Importance Factor
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 1.5-2, for Risk Category II: $I_e = 1.0$.

From ASCE 7-16 Tables 11.6-1 and 11.6-2, with $S_s = 0.75g$ and $S_1 = 0.30g$ for Risk Category II, we need to check if the building is SDC C, D, or E. We will determine $F_a$ and $F_v$ first to confirm.

solution_steps.title: Determine Site Coefficients and Design Spectral Accelerations
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.4-1 (Site Coefficient $F_a$): For Site Class D and $S_s = 0.75$, interpolate between $S_s = 0.5$ ($F_a = 1.4$) and $S_s = 0.75$ ($F_a = 1.3$) and $S_s = 1.0$ ($F_a = 1.2$).

For $S_s = 0.75$, $F_a = 1.3$.

From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.4-2 (Site Coefficient $F_v$): For Site Class D and $S_1 = 0.30$, interpolate between $S_1 = 0.2$ ($F_v = 2.0$) and $S_1 = 0.3$ ($F_v = 1.8$) and $S_1 = 0.4$ ($F_v = 1.6$).

For $S_1 = 0.30$, $F_v = 1.8$.

Adjusted spectral accelerations per Section 11.4.4:
$$S_{MS} = F_a S_s = 1.3 \times 0.75 = 0.975g$$
$$S_{M1} = F_v S_1 = 1.8 \times 0.30 = 0.54g$$

Design spectral accelerations per Section 11.4.5:
$$S_{DS} = \frac{2}{3} S_{MS} = \frac{2}{3} \times 0.975 = 0.65g$$
$$S_{D1} = \frac{2}{3} S_{M1} = \frac{2}{3} \times 0.54 = 0.36g$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Seismic Design Category (SDC)
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.6-1 (based on $S_{DS}$): For $S_{DS} = 0.65g$ and Risk Category II, SDC = D (since $S_{DS} \ge 0.50g$).

From ASCE 7-16 Table 11.6-2 (based on $S_{D1}$): For $S_{D1} = 0.36g$ and Risk Category II, SDC = D (since $S_{D1} \ge 0.20g$).

SDC = D (most severe governs).

solution_steps.title: Determine Response Modification Coefficient and Other Parameters
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Table 12.2-1, for Steel Special Moment Frames (A.1):
$$R = 8$$
$$\Omega_0 = 3$$
$$C_d = 5.5$$

From Section 12.8.2, for SDC D and $S_{DS} = 0.65g$, the building is not permitted to use the ELF procedure if it has a structural irregularity. Assuming no irregularities, ELF is permitted.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Building Weight (Seismic Mass)
solution_steps.content:
Floor area = $100 \times 100 = 10,000$ sq ft.

Roof weight = $10,000 \times 200$ psf $= 2,000,000$ lbs $= 2,000$ kips.
Floor weight (per level) = $10,000 \times 200$ psf $= 2,000$ kips.
Total for 3 floors = $3 \times 2,000 = 6,000$ kips.

Total seismic weight $W$:
$$W = 6,000 + 2,000 = 8,000 \text{ kips}$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Approximate Fundamental Period
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Section 12.8.2.1, for steel moment frames:
$$T_a = C_t h_n^x$$
From Table 12.8-2: $C_t = 0.028$, $x = 0.8$ (for steel moment frames).

$$T_a = 0.028 \times (60)^{0.8}$$
First, $60^{0.8} = e^{0.8 \times \ln(60)} = e^{0.8 \times 4.094} = e^{3.275} = 26.45$
$$T_a = 0.028 \times 26.45 = 0.741 \text{ seconds}$$

Upper limit for $T$ (Section 12.8.2): $C_u T_a$.
From Table 12.8-1, for $S_{D1} = 0.36g \ge 0.30g$, $C_u = 1.4$.
$$T_{max} = C_u T_a = 1.4 \times 0.741 = 1.037 \text{ seconds}$$
We can use $T = T_a = 0.741$ sec for base shear calculation (conservative).

solution_steps.title: Calculate Seismic Response Coefficient $C_s$
solution_steps.content:
From ASCE 7-16 Equation 12.8-2:
$$C_s = \frac{S_{DS}}{R/I_e} = \frac{0.65}{8/1.0} = \frac{0.65}{8} = 0.08125$$

Check maximum $C_s$ from Equation 12.8-3 (for $T \le T_L$):
$$C_{s,max} = \frac{S_{D1}}{T(R/I_e)} = \frac{0.36}{0.741 \times (8/1.0)} = \frac{0.36}{5.928} = 0.06073$$

Check minimum $C_s$ from Equation 12.8-5 (for $S_{DS} \ge 0.65g$, $T \le 0.741$ sec):
$$C_{s,min} = 0.044 S_{DS} I_e \ge 0.01$$
$$C_{s,min} = 0.044 \times 0.65 \times 1.0 = 0.0286 \ge 0.01$$

Also check Equation 12.8-6 for $S_1 \ge 0.6g$? No, $S_1 = 0.30g < 0.6g$, so not applicable.

Governing $C_s = \min(0.08125, 0.06073) = 0.06073$, but not less than 0.0286.
$$C_s = 0.06073$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Seismic Base Shear
solution_steps.content:
ASCE 7-16 Equation 12.8-1:
$$V = C_s W = 0.06073 \times 8,000 \text{ kips}$$
$$V = 485.8 \text{ kips}$$

final_answer: The seismic base shear for the building is $486$ kips.
